ArticleTitle.sentence: Mouse interleukin-2 receptor alpha gene expression.

event.clue: Mouse interleukin-2 receptor alpha gene expression.

ArticleTitle.sentence: Interleukin-1 and interleukin-2 control transcription via distinct cis-acting elements.

event.clue: Interleukin-1 and interleukin-2 control transcription via distinct cis-acting elements.

AbstractText.sentence: We have shown that interleukin-1 (IL-1) and IL-2 control IL-2 receptor alpha (IL-2R alpha) gene transcription in CD4-CD8- murine T lymphocyte precursors.

event.clue: We have shown that interleukin-1 (IL-1) and IL-2 control IL-2 receptor alpha (IL-2R alpha) gene transcription in CD4-CD8- murine T lymphocyte precursors.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we map the cis-acting elements that mediate interleukin responsiveness of the mouse IL-2R alpha gene using a thymic lymphoma-derived hybridoma (PC60).

event.clue: Here we map the cis-acting elements that mediate interleukin responsiveness of the mouse IL-2R alpha gene using a thymic lymphoma-derived hybridoma (PC60).

AbstractText.sentence: The transcriptional response of the IL-2R alpha gene to stimulation by IL-1 + IL-2 is biphasic.

event.clue: The transcriptional response of the IL-2R alpha gene to stimulation by IL-1 + IL-2 is biphasic.
The transcriptional response of the IL-2R alpha gene to stimulation by IL-1 + IL-2 is biphasic.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-1 induces a rapid, protein synthesis-independent appearance of IL-2R alpha mRNA that is blocked by inhibitors of NF-kappa B activation.

event.clue: IL-1 induces a rapid, protein synthesis-independent appearance of IL-2R alpha mRNA that is blocked by inhibitors of NF-kappa B activation.

AbstractText.sentence: It also primes cells to become IL-2 responsive and thereby prepares the second phase, in which IL-2 induces a 100-fold further increase in IL-2R alpha transcripts.

event.clue: It also primes cells to become IL-2 responsive and thereby prepares the second phase, in which IL-2 induces a 100-fold further increase in IL-2R alpha transcripts.
It also primes cells to become IL-2 responsive and thereby prepares the second phase, in which IL-2 induces a 100-fold further increase in IL-2R alpha transcripts.

AbstractText.sentence: Transient transfection experiments show that several elements in the promoter-proximal region of the IL-2R alpha gene contribute to IL-1 responsiveness, most importantly an NF-kappa B site conserved in the human and mouse gene.

event.clue: Transient transfection experiments show that several elements in the promoter-proximal region of the IL-2R alpha gene contribute to IL-1 responsiveness, most importantly an NF-kappa B site conserved in the human and mouse gene.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-2 responsiveness, on the other hand, depends on a 78-nucleotide segment 1.3 kilobases upstream of the major transcription start site.

event.clue: IL-2 responsiveness, on the other hand, depends on a 78-nucleotide segment 1.3 kilobases upstream of the major transcription start site.

AbstractText.sentence: This segment functions as an IL-2-inducible enhancer and lies within a region that becomes DNase I hypersensitive in normal T cells in which IL-2R alpha expression has been induced.

event.clue: This segment functions as an IL-2-inducible enhancer and lies within a region that becomes DNase I hypersensitive in normal T cells in which IL-2R alpha expression has been induced.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-2 responsiveness requires three distinct elements within the enhancer.

event.clue: IL-2 responsiveness requires three distinct elements within the enhancer.

AbstractText.sentence: Two of these are potential binding sites for STAT proteins.
